title: Which Division Is The Worst?
body:
Just a fun little thread/poll to gather people's opinions on what Division is simply the worst to be in! Please vote below, and we'll see what the general concensus is.

And when you vote, please reply to the thread with your answer and reasoning! Also, please rate them on the following reasons:
- Level Of Fun
- Level Of Toxicity
- Level Of Trolling
- Level Of Difficulty
- Level Of True And Total Despair In Elo Hell
(Remember; don't let Teemo hear you complain too much. Or else the Dark Lord will prod you with his poison-tipped, mushroom-emblazoned pitchfork.)

Edit: Feel free to share this thread with your friends or anime-themed body pillows! The more votes and comments, the better!

replies.body:
Silver.  Clusterfuck of people of so many different skill levels.  One game you can trust your team, next they disappoint you more than I've disappointed my father.

One day, I won every game, had amazing team work.
Next day, I lost nearly every game, team kept arguing, had a Nami jungle...
Ah, the war-torn road to escape the Silver Ring of Elo Hell. I know that struggle well, sadly.
Totally agree

Each is bad in its own way. 

**Bronze: Rock Bottom** - Very weak mechanics, next to no teamplay, toxicity usually just comes from 1 player while the rest are either silent or being nice because they are new to the game. Wards are non-existant. Easy to 1-Man Carry out of. **If you're stuck here, you kinda deserve it to some extent. You've got a long way to go.**

**Silver: Hell** - Toxic above all else. Mechanics have improved, teamplay has not. Cooperation is non-existant. Higher abundance of trolls & smurfs. Very difficult to 1-Man Carry, as your teammates will spend more time typing than following your leadership. **If you're stuck here, I don't blame you. It's kinda the equivalent of Death Mountain in Zelda 2.**

**Gold: Oasis in the Desert** - Much more relaxed than Silver. Mechanics are even better, teamplay is becoming a thing, people are warding a lot, and flaming isn't as intense. Trolls and smurfs aren't usually found here. **If you're suck here, you're basically just taking a breather. You've just destroyed the first Death Star, and Yoda is training you for the fight ahead.**

**Platinum: Purgatory** - Imagine Silver, except people can kick your ass much harder. Personal mechanics are pretty much perfected, yet teamplay has gone to shit again. Flaming is up, smurfs are up, and trolls are up. However, people are usually on an even playing field in terms of skill. Warding is also greater. **If you're stuck here, I don't blame you. Just keep trying, and you'll eventually get to Heaven.**

**Diamond: Senior Year** - This is basically a repeat of Gold, except more challenging. Teamplay, warding, and mechanics are all up, while flaming, smurfing, and trolling are all down (but not out, just a warning). **If you're stuck here, be proud of yourself. You've accomplished what the large majority of the playerbase cannot.**

**Masters: Graduation** - You've basically mastered the game, and are rotating in-and-out of Challenger/Diamond. 

**Challenger: Full Time Job** - Yes, you're the best in the region, but you gotta keep playing or else you're gonna get kicked out.
This is insanely accurate.

Haha, I know the feeling. One of my IRL friends recently got into League, and outside of the Rift he is a timid, jolly little twerp. But when he gets into a game...my God, it is as if he's been possessed by the Spirit of Teemo himself; spewing forth gallons of toxic scum wherever he goes. It is truly terrifying, what this game can do to people.
Bronze is fun. You can just use {{item:3512}} everygame, and win due to spitpush pressure.
*GASP* You...you did it...you discovered a way to bring down the Gates that separate us from the other Rings in Elo Hell! YOU BRILLIANT SCHOLAR, YOU! <3
Trick2G almost beat team Dig with Zz'Rot lol

Gold 1 & Plat 4/5. Ever seen teammates play their 30% win ratio champions on a consistent basis? Ever have teammates already calling it quits before minions spawn? Ever seen your teammates face check deep in the enemy jungle 40 minutes into the game? Ever have teammates that are clearly boosted?

Well, sure! I've experienced all of that! I've been playing since Season One; if I hadn't had to deal with any of the problems you just listed, I would be the luckiest SOB in the League.

That being said, those crawling demon-baby Players are weak, but their sheer numbers and annoyance are more than enough to take you out in your playthroughs in Teemo's Inferno.

It is 100% Silver/Gold. You have people who think they are much better than what they actually are and typically are the most likely to blame others for losses.  And while you may argue that pretty much every division has people who are like that, I would counter that notion by stating that these are divisions on the precipice of being considered "good." Silver is the precipice of getting the rewards at the end of the season while Gold is the precipice of entering into Plat which can be considered to be much better than the average. You have people who are here, struggling with hundreds of games played without much movement, essentially Silver/Gold are the ELO doldrums.

Bronze players generally have more experience than Silver players. The placement system is made to cater to new players and make them feel good about themselves by even placing some of the most toxic players in Silver. After that they drop down to Bronze and have hundreds of games in league while many Silver players have barely any.

Ooh, really? I did my placements for the first time and got put in Bronze 3. I currently have a 33% ranked winrate too.

The Placement system is rather wonky in the first place. Here is an example:

I was Gold III at the end of last season. My friend was Gold III too.

He wins 8 of his 10 placement games. And gets placed in Silver IV.

I won 5 of my 10 placement games. And I got placed in Silver I.

After six years, I still don't understand how the MMR system really works. But...oh well. :P

MMR, which is entirely separate to your ranking, is a numerical value for how good the game thinks you are, based on how well you play, how often you win, among other things. Each rank is seen as a certain MMR range. When the ranked reset happens, you are put back into your "proper" division, minus a few tiers. If you belonged where you were, you'll climb back up. If you got lucky and got carried up, you'll stay.

Did you both do promos around the same time? Or did he do his promos a few weeks before you? I have played almost as long as you and although I don't truly understand how mmr works I do know the handicap at the start of seasons lessons over time.
Ranked in general is toxic. Just play premade 5s so you can enjoy ranked.

Those are tiers rather than divisions in the poll strictly speaking. The worst division is X 5 regardless of the X, since it has people from the entire skill range of (X-1) 4 up to actual X 5.

As for the worst tier...Probably silver. Bronze you can at least rely on yourself to get fed so you can try to carry (assuming you're not actually bronze material), and even if you can't quite carry the feeders, you can at least go down fighting.

Silver on the other hand, is a mishmash of first time ranked people who are actually bronze 5 material but haven't finished placements/fallen that far yet, legitimate silvers who are very eh, and people who belong in much higher tiers doing their fresh climb up.
It doesn't matter which division you're in, anything V will be the worst because it's half people who are climbing and salty and half people who are immune from dropping. It's terrible.

Plat in general but definitely plat 1 and plat 5 in particular.

Huge variety of people: people who were boosted/carried by diamond 1 friends, low plats/golds duoing with high plats/diamonds, toxics who are good but mentally ff if they die once, one trick ponies who instalock the same champ every game in any role, people who have amazing mechanics but have the strategy of a mosquito, people who have strategy like Napoleon but the mechanics of a paralyzed guy playing with touchpad, etc.

In plat 1 I had a 0-5 Jarvan top take blue while I was ganking bot because he "needed mana". That says it all.

I understand that the statistics are there stating that Gold is way above the average but it is the mentality of how good a Gold player is vs a Diamond or Plat that causes them to think of it as the average. For example, many times people will insult you if you are below their division. Diamond > Plat > Gold > Silver > Bronze. The only people who aren't overtly toxic to others typically end up in Master/Challenger. Gold and silver see themselves at the near bottom of the ELO totem pole.

Each division has it's ups and downs in communication and skill level. I had a good (short) time in Bronze, and I didn't experience all the gruesome horrors that people describe (until I hit silver). I was Platinum in preseason and it was actually pretty cool (except I did experience more toxicity based on mistakes such as not grouping) but that's better than pointless toxicity

I'd say that any form of toxicity is bad, but I can see where you're coming from. Still, nothing puts me on tilt more than being called out by my supposed teammates. It has gotten to where I must mute them, so I can ignore the deafening screams of the Outer Rings' inhabitants...even if only for a short time.

I myself despise all of the Rings of Elo Hell; each Ring has a unique aspect that makes them their own form of psychological and emotional torture! 

Whenever I played Solo Queue, I felt like Dante from Dante's Inferno, with every Promotion Series being the Boss for that Ring of Elo Hell, my fellow players as the hordes of demons I must contest with, and my desired Ranking being my wife, who I desperately try to save, but she is yoinked from my arms every time I am within reach.

And btw, it is incredibly easy to climb divisions if you have a positive attitude. However, it is the people who don't self-reflect and blame others who don't climb. This is a good topic, but I would say that GOLD is, by far, the worst Elo to play in.  I've never played in Diamond or above so I can't tell you, but sweet, feathery Jesus is Gold frustrating.  

Level of Fun:  2/10 - Every once in awhile there's a really good game where everyone plays at a decent skill level, but those can be counted on one hand every month.  

Level of Toxicity:  8/10 - Gold is ten times as toxic as Bronze or Silver.  There are several reasons for this, not the least of which being that many gold players are MMR boosted accounts to get the free border/special skins/etc.  As a result of MMR boosted accounts and the fact that some people just get way too complacent, Gold has the most mismatched games you'll generally see and this leads to a pretty toxic environment.  

You know how many people will say that Silver has that guy that always promises he'll "carry" on an off-meta pick or claim "I main Ahri, I'll carry", well imagine that you have at least two of these assholes on your team EVERY single game.  Yep.  

Level of Trolling:  4/10 - Trolling isn't quite as bad as it is in Silver/Bronze, but the difference is that in Bronze there are players that just don't know how to build their champion properly and so it may appear to be a troll.  In Gold, however, players should know the basics of what to do and yet you will still see the occasional top laner building damage despite being 3 kills and 50 cs behind or the slightly fed Fizz trying to 1v4 in Dragon pit.  This isn't neccessarily "trolling", but it's pretty stupid and gives the appearance of trolling.  

Again, there are the off-meta hero types that make crazy picks (always in my promos) and swear that they went 22-1 in their last game as Sona top, but in my game they go 1/8 and rage quit.  

Level of Difficulty:  7/10 - Games get sideways often and it's either an easy win or a horrendous loss, not much room in-between.  Now that Rift-Herald is a thing, the team that gets ahead, stays ahead and it's nearly impossible to come back.  On the other hand, if you're ahead most teams don't generally throw as much as they do in Bronze or Silver.  

Level of True and Total Despair in Elo Hell:  9/10 - I'd much rather play in Silver or Bronze than Gold or Plat, period.

Probably silver or plat. I've played with plenty of players from all divisions but master and challenger and these 2 are by far my least favorite. Silver players are terrible and flame and plat is a mess of different forms of skill with some players that honestly I don't know how they're plat.

Silver, specifically low silver. Now you have really bad players who think their ok because they are silver. Silver still has the low elo hell aspect combined with the highest population of players in mid to late season. It is also where most plat or gold new smurf accounts land. So each game there will be some generally good players, sometimes horrible players, and then average players. Gets to be a real clusterfuck. 

At least in bronze you can assume your team is bad and realize you have to carry and the game is going to have a team death match aspect to it. The farther you get in silver the better players get on average and although not great it can be a little harder to carry. Silver 2 is the worst of the worst in my biased opinion.

In my opinion though Bronze has a lot of people who rage, are toxic, flame ,feed etc, there is also a lot of good players who get held back because of the other said players, leavers, and AFKS. This makes the good players upset at their denied higher ranking and renews the cycle of hate/toxicity. 

Almost any rank above Bronze is bad, yes people play good, coordinate better, etc...But if I am to be made fun of/yelled at for not being ranked/bronze/silver and they mess up and blame me or my lower rank teammates it's the worst. I've had matches even in ARAM with plat players and they DC because two or three people are not gold+ on my team or because they "dont want to play with low elo" and it's VERY sad. I've had NORMAL non ranked games with gold+ and they rage because the bronze/silver/whatever messed up once; almost as bad as Bronze people do.
